snippet: In nearly four decades with FIFA, Sepp Blatter, the outspoken and commanding figurehead, has never overseen an issue as controversial as whether to shift the Qatar World Cup from summer to winter.
abstract: Sepp Blatter, imposing president of FIFA who has been with organization for nearly four decades, faces toughest quandary of his career in debate over whether to shift World Cup 2022, in Qatar, from summer to winter; issue, prompted by Qatar's sweltering summer heat, has been hotly contested by fans; Blatter is said to favor change in date.

byline.original: By SAM BORDEN and JAMES MONTAGUE

lead_paragraph: In nearly four decades with FIFA, Sepp Blatter, the outspoken and commanding figurehead, has never overseen an issue as controversial as whether to shift the Qatar World Cup from summer to winter.

headline.main: In FIFA Politics, Blatter Is the Consummate Player
